head.supplied: Monga ¶ 5/1/89. ¶ […] ¶ ¶ The three logs I forward now were cut in September, when theweather in this locality (3,000f above sealevel) was very coldyet. Nro. 101 Mountain Ash, Baron von Muller former...

div.p: MRS 203, Inwards correspondence — special bundles, 1886-1921 Item 1, 89/4, Archives of the Powerhouse Museum, Sydney.

The three logs I forward now were cut in September, when theweather in this locality (3,000f above sealevel) was very coldyet. Nro. 101 Mountain Ash, Baron von Muller formerlydetermined as Eucal. amygdalina var , but to judge by the shape of the fruit there seems to be some doubt about it. This year I have forwarded to him complete material: budding, flowering, and fruiting specimens, as well as leaves in the young state, with desctiption of bark etc, the result of which is that he says, he will subject the material to critical examination later on, and then send me the name. […]

Of Log Nro 103 I sent you all the particulars, concerning, Bark, Gum etc, lately. The species is not determined, but I have fruiting specimens with the seed quite ripe ready now, to send to Baron von Muller. Flowering specimens I had sent in the spring, consequently there ought to be nothing more in the way for its final determination. […]
Not relevant.
